This indicates ongoing economic activity and better compliance.

items.summary: The specialists, often former senior defence and government officials, help law firms create viable bid strategies for clients seeking defence contracts. Their experience is also invaluable during tough negotiations and compliance reviews. Also much in vogue are tech experts including engineers and technology-domain specialists, especially in aerospace, avionics, electronics, AI/ML systems, unmanned platforms, secure communications and dual-use technologies.

items.summary: Speaking on an episode of The Joe Rogan Experience, Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang ‘flat out’ that the current growth of the AI industry in the US would not have been possible without Trump's energy policies. Trump reportedly also met Huang on Wednesday.

items.title: ET Graphics: As Rupee breaches 90, a look at who loses and who gains
items.summary: The Indian rupee has hit a historic low against the dollar. This slide raises concerns about import costs and stock market stability. However, the economy shows resilience with strong growth and low inflation. Experts are examining who is affected by this currency movement and who might benefit from it.

items.title: Gurugram affordable housing gains momentum, giving middle-class buyers hope

items.title: More than rupee level, its non-volatility is key: Bajaj

He downplayed concerns about the rupee potentially reaching 90 against the dollar, highlighting that a low-interest rate climate is conducive to growth in India's manufacturing and infrastructure sectors.

items.title: '8th Economic Census to be held in 2027': Statistics Secretary Saurabh Garg
items.summary: India will conduct its eighth Economic Census in 2027. This census will follow the population census. Data from the Economic Census will establish a statistical business register. This register will map all enterprises across states. It will track their operational status. The Economic Census provides vital information for policy decisions. The population census is scheduled for 2026 and 2027.

items.title: 'Reduce dependence on any single geography for long-term resilience': Piyush Goyal
items.summary: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal has urged Indian industry to identify weaknesses and innovate for future growth. He stressed reducing reliance on any single country due to the weaponization of trade. Goyal highlighted India's strong economic performance with 8.2% growth and low inflation. He emphasized self-sufficiency in critical products and strengthening domestic supply chains.

items.title: Opening up nuclear power sector to private firms - An overview
items.summary: India's nuclear energy sector is preparing for a significant transformation. New laws are being introduced to boost nuclear power capacity to 100 GW by 2047. These changes will allow private companies to participate and address concerns regarding liability and fuel supply. This move aims to meet rising energy demands and support India's growth as a developed economy.

items.title: Labour codes likely to be fully operational from April 1, 2026, Govt to pre-publish draft rules soon

items.title: 'Draft Atomic Energy Bill in advanced stage, taking in all ministry inputs': Jitendra Singh

Discussions with Russia's Rosatom are progressing on nuclear energy cooperation. This includes developing both large and small nuclear power plants. Focus is also on localizing equipment production. Small modular reactors are a key area of discussion.

items.title: CII president Rajiv Memani bats for fresh manufacturing reforms, sovereign wealth fund

This plan aims to reduce import dependence and foster local production, creating significant economic value.

items.title: Higher pharma, chemicals exports to Russia bloc on agenda to trim deficit

The agreement aims to reduce India's trade deficit with Russia. Discussions focus on product categories and potential restrictions. This move comes ahead of Russian President Vladimir Putin's visit. The EAEU market presents significant opportunities for Indian businesses.

The development emphasizes privacy, precision, and experiential living. It offers modern Art Deco styling and resort-like amenities. BKC is a prime business district with excellent connectivity.

items.title: India's January-October iron ore imports at six-year high, JSW Steel top buyer
items.summary: India's iron ore imports have reached a six-year peak. Steel mills are buying more from abroad to secure high-grade ore and benefit from lower international prices. JSW Steel is the leading overseas buyer. This trend is driven by domestic production challenges and the convenience of importing for coastal plants. Imports are expected to remain high.

items.title: India's services growth accelerates in November but export engine sputters, PMI shows
items.summary: India's services sector saw strong growth in November, boosted by domestic demand. However, export sales experienced their slowest expansion in eight months. This divergence highlights robust local consumption. Input cost inflation eased significantly, supporting expectations of an interest rate cut. Employment growth remained modest, and business confidence dipped amid competitive pressures.

items.title: Multibagger stock RPP Infra Projects pops 8% on securing  ₹26 crore order
items.summary: RPP Infra Projects shares rose 8% to  ₹115.60 on Dec 3 after securing a  ₹26 crore highway order but trimmed gains to trade 1.5% higher at  ₹108.90 amid a broader market sell-off.

items.summary: Putin’s visit to New Delhi offers both India and Russia an opportunity to look beyond the past and find new pathways for cooperation that can yield mutual benefits in a context defined by rapid geopolitical changes. How the talks go will be keenly watched.

items.title: Vietnam raises $298 mln in govt bond auction
items.summary: Vietnam's State Treasury successfully raised 7.85 trillion dong in a recent government bond auction, a significant increase from the previous week. This auction boosted total government bond sales for 2025 to 300.7 trillion dong, meeting 60% of the year's target.  While 10-year bonds saw strong demand, other maturities remained unsold. Corporate bond issuances also remain robust.

items.title: JGB yields rise on concerns over further rate hikes after December meeting
items.summary: Japanese government bond yields climbed as investors anticipate further interest rate hikes from the Bank of Japan beyond the expected December increase.  Concerns are mounting over the BOJ's future policy path, with the two-year yield reaching 1.015%.  Governor Ueda's hints of rate hikes have already triggered significant JGB sell-offs, impacting stocks and strengthening the yen.

Analysts highlight its advantage from timing, positioning, and long-standing relationships, while its Karnataka SEZ campus offers a rare fully integrated ecosystem covering machining, forging, surface treatment, and assembly.

items.title: Why did Indian Bank, PNB, Bank of India and other PSU banks crash up to 6%? Explained
items.summary: State-owned banks faced selling pressure as all 12 constituents declined after the government ruled out raising the foreign direct investment limit in public sector banks. The Nifty PSU Bank index dropped 3%, reflecting the broad weakness in the sector.

items.title: Silver jumps to all-time high of Rs 1.84 lakh/kg amid rupee slide
items.summary: Silver prices surged to a record Rs 1,84,727 per kilogram on Wednesday. Gold futures also advanced to Rs 1,30,766 per 10 grams. A steep fall in the rupee to an all-time low against the US dollar further pushed up bullion prices. Global trends of expected US Federal Reserve interest rate cuts supported the rise.

items.title: AI boom, tariffs and a softening labour market shape a cautious 2026 outlook
items.summary: Wall Street remains largely bullish for 2026, but optimism is tempered by an unusual economic scenario unseen in over 60 years. Despite the AI investment boom driving capital spending, it hasn’t boosted job creation, creating an unprecedented mix of strong market activity alongside a stalling U.S. labor market, according to JPMorgan economists.

items.title: BofA joins growing chorus expecting Fed rate cut in December
items.summary: Bank of America has joined major brokerages, including Goldman Sachs and J.P. Morgan, in forecasting a 25-bps Fed rate cut at the December meeting, as softer labour data and dovish FOMC commentary boost expectations. Markets now price an 87% probability of easing, though a few institutions still expect no change.

items.summary: The AI boom may presage a tech revolution. Yet, the stock market surge it has led is narrow and the industry has veered into risky territory with worrisome debt levels and circular deals exposing the financial world to contagion. AI could succeed, but will investors?

This follows five straight days of decline, despite efforts by the Reserve Bank of India to intervene. The fall reflects ongoing weakness in capital inflows, strong demand from importers, and uncertainty over a US-India trade deal.

items.summary:
Sensex, Nifty updates on 3 December 2025:  India’s benchmark indices extended losses for the fourth straight session on Wednesday, weighed down by delays in the US trade deal and a record-low rupee. Sensex closed at 85,106.81, slipping 31.46 points or 0.04%, after touching an intraday low of 84,763.64. The Nifty 50 declined 46.20 points (0.18%) to settle at 25,986. The Indian rupee ended at a record closing low of 90.19 per U.S. dollar, down 0.36% from the previous close.

items.summary: Silver saw a dip on Tuesday, but its blistering rally this year has been led not just by investors seeking refuge from uncertainty, but by booming demand from clean-tech and other industries that use it as an input. How far can prices go?

items.title: Marvell Rallies After Upbeat CEO Remarks, Celestial AI Deal
items.summary: Marvell Technology Inc. rallied in late trading after reassuring investors that its custom chip-design unit is winning repeat orders, signaling continued growth as the company benefits from runaway spending on AI computing.

items.title: IIT placements bring startups into a hiring war with the bigwigs, who wins?
items.summary: This year's IIT placements see startups offering higher salaries and bonuses but struggle to attract top talent, competing with tech giants. While many firms aim for IPOs, enthusiasm for startups remains low among IIT students compared to NITs and IIITs.

items.title: Time, not capital, is a disruptor: Wakefit founder Ramalingegowda
items.summary: The company, which started as a direct-to-consumer player, now sells through marketplaces, quick commerce, its own website, channels, and offline stores. It has around 125 stores and plans to open another 170 over the next 12 to 18 months.

items.title: Export promotion measures launched to offset tariffs
items.summary: India is actively working to lessen the effects of the US tariff increase on its exports. The government is launching an export promotion mission to boost trade diversification and resilience. Measures include engaging with the US for a trade agreement, providing immediate relief through RBI measures, and announcing a credit guarantee scheme for exporters.

items.title: India's seafood exports rise, led by EU, China, Vietnam
items.summary: Indian seafood exports saw a strong rise in the first seven months of FY26. Shipments to the European Union, China, Vietnam, Russia, and the United Kingdom surged. This growth helped compensate for reduced exports to the United States. The European Union saw a substantial increase in seafood value. Russia also increased its imports from India.

items.title: Govt eases 'small company' rules, more firms to benefit
items.summary: The government has expanded the definition of small companies. This change allows more businesses to benefit from easier compliance rules and quicker merger processes. Companies with paid-up capital up to ₹10 crore and turnover up to ₹100 crore now qualify. These new rules aim to boost ease of doing business in India.

items.title: Panel seeks fast-track courts to expedite insolvency cases
items.summary: A parliamentary panel urges the government to establish special fast-track courts and bolster the National Company Law Tribunal. This aims to clear a massive backlog of insolvency cases and speed up company rescues. The committee also proposed an advance ruling system for greater certainty. These measures are expected to improve the resolution process and protect creditor interests.

items.title: ​Speedbreakers ahead: On India’s economic data
items.summary: The third quarter is unlikely to bring cheer for the economy

items.title: Hedge Funds’ Leveraged Bond Trades Draw Regulatory Scrutiny
items.summary: The government-bond trades of the world’s largest hedge funds are facing increased regulatory scrutiny, as officials mull policies that would cap the leverage — and profitability — of popular strategies.

items.title: 'Reforms are driving demand, capacity use': Ficci President Anant Goenka
items.summary: India's economy is poised for strong growth, projected to exceed 7% in fiscal 2026. The Ficci president highlights reforms and macro fundamentals driving this expansion. A key goal is boosting manufacturing's contribution to GDP. Discussions also cover budget expectations, including increased capital outlay for defence and electronics, and support for exports.

items.title: RBI likely to raise forecast for growth, lower it for inflation this MPC
items.summary: Market watchers anticipate the Reserve Bank of India will adjust its economic forecasts this Friday.  Expectations are for a higher growth projection and a lower inflation estimate for the fiscal year 2026.  This comes after stronger than anticipated GDP figures and moderating inflation.  Analysts foresee a significant drop in inflation projections.  Growth forecasts are also expected to be revised upwards.

items.title: OECD retains India's FY26 growth outlook at 6.7%
items.summary: India's economy is set for strong growth, projected at 6.7% in FY26 by the OECD. This expansion is fueled by increasing incomes, supportive monetary policy, and government investment. Reforms in infrastructure, education, and trade are key to sustaining this momentum. While US tariffs may impact exports, domestic consumption remains robust.

items.title: GST rate rationalisation has largely fixed inverted duty structure, says Sitharaman
items.summary: In a significant development, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman revealed that the recent adjustments to the Goods and Services Tax rates have effectively addressed the inverted duty challenges faced by various sectors. She reassured businesses that any further issues they identify will be promptly addressed. Now, essential goods are taxed at either zero or 5% GST.

items.title: FM calls for global cooperation on digital-era tax transparency
items.summary: In a call for unity, India’s Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman emphasized the need for international collaboration to tackle tax transparency challenges. With the rise of digital assets and evolving financial products, adapting to these changes is imperative. The swift exchange of information becomes critical, particularly in the realm of cryptocurrencies.

items.title: IRFC secures $300 million loan from Japan's Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corporation
items.summary: The ECB facility, which has a tenor of five years, is benchmarked to the Tokyo Overnight Average Rate (TONAR). The proceeds from this facility are earmarked for projects that are closely associated with the railway sector or other ventures approved under ECB guidelines.

items.title: India–Russia ties: What to expect from Putin’s high-stakes visit as New Delhi navigates US pressure
items.summary: President Putin's visit marks a critical juncture for India, solidifying its position as Russia's largest oil supplier and a key defense partner. items.title: Stock Market Highlights today December 2, 2025: Sensex tanks nearly 504 pts, Nifty slips to 26,032 on selling in bank stocks, Reliance
items.summary:
Sensex, Nifty, Share Prices Highlights: Stock markets declined on Tuesday, with the benchmark Sensex tumbling nearly 504 points due to selling in blue-chip bank stocks and Reliance Industries, and persistent foreign fund outflows.

Falling for the third straight session, the 30-share BSE Sensex tumbled 503.63 points or 0.59 per cent to settle at 85,138.27. During the day, the benchmark tanked 588.9 points or 0.68 per cent to hit a low of 85,053. The index had scaled a record high level in intra-day trade in the previous session, but closed lower due to profit booking in the second half.
